metadata.dc:description: The relationship between neuromuscular diseases and the heart has been well known for many years. Cardiac lesions tend to involve the specialized conducting system. We report the case of a 36-year-old male diagnosed with Steinert's myotonic dystrophy whose initial cardiovascular symptom was heart failure and not symptoms related to alterations of the specialized conducting system.
metadata.dc:title: Insuficiencia cardíaca como manifestación cardiológica inicial de la distrofia miotónica de Steinert.
[Heart failure as the initial cardiac manifestation of Steinert's myotonic dystrophy].
